{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/title|min_exponent10}}
{{cpp/types/numeric_limits/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++11
|dcl1=
static const int min_exponent10;
|dcl2=
static constexpr int min_exponent10;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::min_exponent10}} is the lowest negative number {{c|n}} such that {{mathjax-or|\(\scriptsize 10^n\)|10{{su|p=n}}}} is a valid normalized value of the floating-point type {{tt|T}}.

===Example===
{{example
|Demonstrates the relationships of {{lc|min_exponent}}, {{tt|min_exponent10}}, {{lc|min()}}, and {{lc|radix}} for the type {{c/core|float}}:
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;limits&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "min() = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::min() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "min_exponent10 = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::min_exponent10 &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; std::hexfloat &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "min() = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::min() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "min_exponent = " &lt;&lt; std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::min_exponent &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
min() = 1.17549e-38
min_exponent10 = -37

min() = 0x1p-126
min_exponent = -125
}}
